meta.name: Forget Me Not Investigator Expansion
meta.description:
Horror is brewing in Buenos Aires... And five new investigators are trapped in the middle of it.
Play with 121 new cards, including both upgrades and downgrades to existing cards and plenty of new cards to explore and expand your typical deck archetypes.
meta.author: TomásAmi
meta.banner_credit: Fabian Perez, Argentina Polo, Julio Moises Madrid, Pablo Gonzáles

cards.back_flavor: Born to a wealthy family, Facundo had the almost perfect life in Buenos Aires. Plenty of friends, captain of the football team, good grades and prospects for almost any job. It would've been perfect if Sofia could see in him what he saw in her. Since they were children they were best friends, and it was that built up trust that made him her personal bodyguard later on. Now he had to see her every day and every night, escort her everywhere she went, and see those pathetic "boyfriends" she changed every now and then. But there was one in particular he didn't like one bit. That damned man with the carmesi coat.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-4, Talent assets level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5 Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Chivalry, Unrequited Love, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Setup: If one of the investigators this game is Sofía Ortega, you begin each game with Chivalry as an additional card in your opening hand.
cards.flavor: "Ms. Ortega, I think it's best if we get going."
cards.name: Facundo Muñiz
cards.text: [reaction] After you defeat an enemy: Another investigator at your location immediately takes one of the following basic actions (move, evade, or investigate). (Limit once per phase). [elder_sign] effect: +2. You may ready a Talent asset you control.

cards.flavor: "With as much time as me in the job, you learn to hold your punches."
cards.name: Chivalry
cards.text:
Facundo Muñiz deck only.
[reaction] When you would fail an attack against an enemy engaged with another investigator, exhaust Chivalry: That attack deals no damage. Draw 1 card.

cards.name: Unrequited Love
cards.text: Revelation - Put Unrequited Love into play in your threat area. Forced - When another investigator moves from your location, take 1 damage and 1 horror. [action][action]: Discard Unrequited Love. Facundo Muñiz cannot activate this ability.

cards.back_flavor: Sofía always had everything. Rich parents that catered to her every need and fulfilled her every wish. Money for a good private education, and more money to start her own business tracking, buying, and re-selling "enchanted" antiques. On a second note, she didn't have much besides money. Money and her good friend Facundo, who was by her side her whole life. He was like a brother to her, always caring and protecting her. Perhaps too much. It was that reason she couldn't tell him of the unspeakable things the man in the red coat promised to do if she didn't find this 'key,' whatever it was.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Connection, Favor and/or Fortune cards level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Escort Me, Attention Seeker, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Setup: If one of the investigators this game is Facundo Muñiz, you begin each game with Escort Me as an additional card in your opening hand.
cards.flavor: "Oh, relax! Here, have another drink."
cards.name: Sofía Ortega
cards.text:
[reaction] After you discover the last clue at your location: Another investigator at your location draws 1 card and gain 2 resources. (Limit once per game at each location.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. Another investigator at your location may draw 1 card or gain 1 resource.

cards.flavor: "Good thing is I don't have to be alone no longer."
cards.name: Escort Me
cards.text:
Sofía Ortega deck only.
[reaction] As you move to a connecting location, give 1 of your resources to another investigator at your location: That investigator moves to that location as well.

cards.name: Attention Seeker
cards.text: Revelation - Put Attention Seeker into play in your threat area. Forced - After you succeed at a skill test to which no other investigator at your location committed a card, take 1 damage and 1 horror. [action][action]: Discard Attention Seeker. Sofía Ortega cannot activate this ability.

cards.back_flavor: Born to the infamous Amato Family, Francisco grew up in a country club on the outskirts of Rosario, Santa Fe. Heir to the Family at the mere age of 22, after Don Andrea died in a raid to their home, he started making some changes around, trying to clean his family's name. But there's only so many changes you can do to a business like his before people start giving you the looks. One day, an offer he couldn't refuse showed to his door, and one that looked suspiciously clean at that. With the reward, he could finally step out of the business. Retrieve some kind of "key"? That was all?
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Secondary Class Choice: At deck creation, choose Guardian ([guardian]), Seeker ([seeker]), or Survivor ([survivor]). Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, cards that take up a hand, accessory, and/or body slot from the chosen class level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): The Family, Officer De Rosa, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No non-Criminal allies.
cards.flavor: Pancho for the family, Don Amato for the rest.
cards.name: Don Francisco Amato
cards.text: You have 1 additional hand, accessory, or body slot for each Criminal asset you control. [elder_sign] effect: +2. You may remove 1 debt from an asset you control.

cards.name: The Family
cards.text: Permanent. Don Francisco Amato deck only. [free] Exhaust The Family and spend 1 resource: Choose a Criminal asset from your hand and put it into play. Place 1 resource from the token pool on it, as a debt. Forced - When a Criminal with a debt on it leaves play: Pay its cost. Take 1 damage or horror for each resource you cannot pay.

cards.name: Officer De Rosa
cards.text: Revelation - Put Officer De Rosa into play with 3 resources on him (from the token pool), as debts. He cannot leave play while he has debt on him. Forced - At the end of your turn: You must either pay 1 resource or take 1 direct damage and horror. [free] Exhaust Officer De Rosa and spend 1 resource: Remove 1 debt from him. If he has no more debt on him, discard him.

cards.back_flavor: As a child, Lucas suffered a horrible mishap. During a trekking trip with his family in El Chaltén, Santa Cruz, he wandered off and got lost. He spent two days in the wilderness, battling hunger and the biting cold before being found—practically frozen yet inexplicably alive. How he survived remains a mystery to this day. Many mistakes later, he now finds himself in Buenos Aires, surviving rather than living, drifting wherever the Murga takes him. His days blur into a haze of colorful costumes and hypnotic rhythms. Whenever he stops dancing, he swears he hears voices whispering from the shadows, claiming he owes them—a debt of survival, a price yet unpaid.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-3, cards with "evade" level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other Rogue and/or Survivor cards ([rogue] and/or [survivor]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Dance with the Dead, Tough Crowd, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Lucas Roca
cards.text:
[reaction] When you would evade a  non-swarm enemy via an ability printed on a card (choose one):
- Draw 1 card.
- Gain 2 resources.
- You succeed by 2 more.
[elder_sign] effect: +0. You may ready an exhausted enemy at your location, if you do, you automatically succeed, and may return the top card of your discard pile to your hand.

cards.flavor: Wake up, beg, scavenge, dance. Dancing is what keeps him sane. Wake up, beg, scavenge, dance. Dancing is what keeps him sane...
cards.name: Dance with the Dead
cards.text:
Lucas Roca deck only.
[reaction] When you would choose one option for Lucas Roca's [reaction] ability, exhaust Dance with the Dead: Choose two instead.

cards.name: Tough Crowd
cards.text: Alert. Aloof. Hunter. Forced - After Tough Crowd enters play: Place 1 doom on it. Forced - After an investigator evades an enemy at Tough Crowd location, if it's ready: Tough Crowd attacks that investigator.

cards.back_flavor: Born and raised in La Pampa, Martín learnt to work from a very early age. With the ever growing and demanding city of Buenos Aires, people from the countryside started heading there for the new opportunities, leaving people like Martín behind with an also ever increasing amount of work. For years he worked until late in the night, until one day, when he ran out of oil in the lanterns and noticed another light in the dark, stalking and silent. The light came back every night, now even visible in the light of the lanterns. Martín headed to Buenos Aires in seek of assistance with these strange encounters.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 35. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, cards with "basic action" level 0-5, Tool cards level 0, Neutral cards level 0-5 Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Galán, Hard Work, La Luz Mala, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Martín Ferraro
cards.text: Your base maximum hand size is 5. [action] For each card below your maximum hand size, one at a time, choose a different one: (Limit once per round.) - Take an action. - You get +2 skill value for your next skill test this round. - Move to a connecting location. - Draw 1 card. - This action gets Parley. [elder_sign] effect: +1. If the test succeeds, you may draw or discard a card.

cards.name: Galán
cards.text:
Martin Ferraro deck only.
While you have no cards in your hand, you get     +1 [willpower], +1 [intellect], +1 [combat], and +1 [agility].
[action] Discard a non-weakness card from your hand: Gain 2 resources.

cards.flavor: Through sweat and resolve, every obstacle bends through hard work.
cards.name: Hard Work
cards.text:
Martin Ferraro deck only.
Play Hard Work as an exact copy of an event in your discard pile. Remove the chosen event from the game.

cards.name: La Luz Mala
cards.text: Peril. Hidden. Hunter. Revelation - Secretly add this enemy to your hand. [reaction] When you reach or exceed your maximum hand size, spawn La Luz Mala engaged with you. Forced - While La Luz Mala is in your hand, whenever any amount of cards would leave your hand, it attacks you.

cards.name: Assistant Bodyguard
cards.text: Assistant Bodyguard may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location. [reaction] When a non-Elite enemy would spawn engaged with another investigator at your location, exhaust Assistant Bodyguard: Spawn that enemy engaged with you instead.

cards.name: Charitable Soul
cards.text:
Uses (0 resources).
[free] Exhaust Charitable Soul: Move 1 resource from your resource pool to Charitable Soul.
Resources on Charitable Soul may be spent by any investigator at your location.

cards.name: Glisenti 1910
cards.text: Uses (6 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. If you played an event that activated this [action] ability, or is played in reaction to this [action] ability, you get +1 [combat] and the attacks deals +1 damage.

cards.flavor: "Slow process for quick unloading"
cards.name: Handloading
cards.text: Uses (0 ammo). Limit 5 ammo on Handloading. [free] Exhaust Handloading: Place 1 ammo on it. [action] Exhaust and discard Handloading: Move all ammo from it to a Firearm asset you control.

cards.name: M1918 BAR
cards.text:
Uses (5 ammo).
[action] Spend 1-3 ammo: Fight. You get +X [combat] for this attack. Instead of its standard damage, this attack deals X damage. X is the amount of ammo spent as part of this ability's cost.

cards.name: Cover Fire
cards.text: Fast. Play when you activate the Fight ability on a Firearm asset. Spend 1 additional ammo token from that asset. If you succeed, automatically evade the attacked enemy. If it's non-Elite, it does not ready during the next upkeep phase.

cards.name: Kick in the Noggin
cards.text: Play only during your turn. Fight. This attack is automatically successful. For each remaining action on your turn, this attack deals +1 damage. After this test ends, end your turn.

cards.name: Under Pressure
cards.text: Play only as your first action. Resolve an [action] ability on a Firearm asset you control against an enemy engaged with another investigator, without paying its [action] cost. Reveal 2 tokens instead of 1. If a chaos token with a non-negative modifier is revealed during this attack, you get +2 [combat] for this attack, and it deals +1 damage.

cards.name: Whodunit?
cards.text: Look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. If among the looked-at cards there is a(n)... - Enemy or Trap: Replenish 1 use from an asset at your location. - Omen or Terror: Take 1 horror. You may discard one of the looked-at cards. - Hazard or Obstacle: An investigator at your location may move to a connecting location. Then, return them to the top of that deck in any order.

cards.name: Barrage
cards.text:
As an additional cost to commit Barrage to a skill test, spend up to 3 ammo from among assets you control.
For each ammo spent in this way, Barrage gains [wild] [wild].

cards.name: Heavy Duty Boots
cards.text: Limit 1 Footwear per investigator. [free] Exhaust Heavy Duty Boots and deal 1 damage to them: Choose one -- - Move. Activate only if you are moving from or to a connecting location with an Obstacle or Hazard attached. - You get +2 skill value while resolving abilities on Obstacle or Hazard treacheries until the end of the phase.

cards.name: Fastest Gun in the West
cards.text: Fast. Play when you activate the Fight ability on a Firearm asset. Use the attacked enemy's evade value for this attack, instead of their fight value. If this attack is successful, it deals +1 damage.

cards.name: Helping Hand
cards.text:
You may commit Helping Hand to any type of test. Max 1 committed per test.
While Helping Hand is committed to a skill test, double the skill icons of each other card committed to that test. If this test succeeds, the performing investigator draws 1 card and gains 1 resource.

cards.flavor: "Move! Get out of here!"
cards.name: Evacuation Coordinator
cards.text: [free] During your turn, exhaust Evacuation Coordinator: Choose another investigator at your location that is not engaged with any enemies. Move that investigator to a connecting location with no enemies.

cards.flavor: "Papa heard the call of the sea and he had to answer. One day, you will understand."
cards.name: Jamie Snell
cards.text: [reaction] After you activate the [free] ability on a [guardian] Talent asset you control, exhaust Jamie Snell: Perform that [free] two more times, ignoring all costs.

cards.name: Innate Talent
cards.text: Limit 1 per investigator. Uses (2 resources). Replenish these resources at the start of each round. Resources on Innate Talent may be spent to pay for Talent cards, or [free] abilities on Talent assets you control.

cards.name: Innate Talent
cards.text: Permanent. Exceptional. Uses (2 resources). Replenish these resources at the start of each round. Resources on Innate Talent may be spent to pay for Talent cards, or [free] abilities on Talent assets you control.

cards.name: Snipe
cards.text: Play only as your first action. As an additional cost to play Snipe, spend an action. Resolve an [action] ability on a Ranged or Firearm asset you control without paying its [action] cost. During that action, treat each symbol token you reveal as a [elder_sign] token. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.name: Glisenti 1910
cards.text: Uses (6 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If you played an event that activated this [action] ability, or is played in reaction to this [action] ability, the attacks deals +2 damage.

cards.name: Amphisbœna Charm
cards.text: Purchase at deck creation. You may include up to 1[per_investigator] copies of Amphisbœna Charm in your deck. Play Amphisbœna Charm under the control of any investigator at your location. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced - After all the copies in your deck of Amphisbœna Charm are in play: Each investigator with a copy draws 1 card and takes an action as if it were they turn. Remove all copies from the game. Record in your Campaign Log that "you are now many in one."

cards.flavor: Back to the beginning.
cards.name: Back to Index
cards.text:
Uses (3 secrets).
[action] Spend 1 secret: An investigator at your location shuffles all non-weakness cards from their hand into their deck. Then, they draw that many cards.

cards.flavor: "You said GLAH-ah-kee? That must be in the fantasy section. Follow me."
cards.name: Miskatonic Archivist
cards.text: [reaction] After Miskatonic Archivist enters play: Shuffle all non-weakness cards from your hand into your deck. Then, draw that many cards.

cards.flavor: "For those who read of evil and search for its form within their minds call forth evil..." -- Ramsey Campbell, "Cold Print"
cards.name: The Revelations of Glaaki
cards.text: [free] Exhaust The Revelations of Glaaki and take 1 horror: Place 1 secret on an asset at your location.

cards.flavor: "I... have been here before."
cards.name: Deeper Meaning
cards.text:
Fast. Play after you discover the last clue at your location.
Investigators at that location draw 1 card each.

cards.name: Find Alternatives
cards.text: Max 2 Finds per round. Find -- An investigator at your location draws 1 card.

cards.name: Find Respite
cards.text: Max 2 Finds per round. Find -- An investigator at your location heals 1 horror.

cards.flavor: "A good exchange for sure, miss Sofia."
cards.name: Trading Antiques
cards.text: An investigator at your location may reveal a card from their hand, and shuffle it into their deck. Then, they search the top 9 cards of their deck for a card, draw it, and shuffle their deck. If both cards shared a trait, you gain 2 resources.

cards.flavor: "How did my things end up here?"
cards.name: Unexpected Discovery
cards.text: Fast. Play after you discover the last clue at your location. Play an Item asset from your hand, reducing its cost by your location's shroud.

cards.name: Research Funding
cards.text:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing.
Other investigators can commit cards to this skill test from any location.

cards.name: Prophetic Vase
cards.text: Revelation - When you draw Prophetic Vase attach it to your location. [action]: Return Prophetic Vase to its owners hand. Draw 3 cards or gain 3 resources, or any combination thereof. Any investigator at Prophetic Vase's location may trigger this ability.

cards.flavor:
"Eureka!"
"Again? Use another phrase for God's sake."
cards.name: Eureka!
cards.text: If this skill test is successful, an investigator at your location may search the top 5 cards of their deck for a card, draw it, and shuffle their deck.

cards.name: Amphisbœna Charm
cards.text:
Researched. You may include up to 1[per_investigator] copies of Amphisbœna Charm in your deck. Play Amphisbœna Charm under the control of any investigator at your location. Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] When you would test your [combat], exhaust Amphisbœna Charm: Use the [combat] of another investigator that controls a copy of this asset. If you succeed, they draw a card.

cards.name: Amphisbœna Charm
cards.text:
Researched. You may include up to 1[per_investigator] copies of Amphisbœna Charm in your deck. Play Amphisbœna Charm under the control of any investigator at your location. Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] When you would test your [intellect], exhaust Amphisbœna Charm: Use the [intellect] of another investigator that controls a copy of this asset. If you succeed, they draw a card.

cards.name: Amphisbœna Charm
cards.text:
Researched. You may include up to 1[per_investigator] copies of Amphisbœna Charm in your deck. Play Amphisbœna Charm under the control of any investigator at your location. Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] When you would test your [agility], exhaust Amphisbœna Charm: Use the [agility] of another investigator that controls a copy of this asset. If you succeed, they draw a card.

cards.name: Amphisbœna Charm
cards.text:
Researched. You may include up to 1[per_investigator] copies of Amphisbœna Charm in your deck. Play Amphisbœna Charm under the control of any investigator at your location. Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] When you would test your [willpower], exhaust Amphisbœna Charm: Use the [willpower] of another investigator that controls a copy of this asset. If you succeed, they draw a card.

cards.name: Experiment Monitoring
cards.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] After another investigator at your location draws any number of cards on your turn, exhaust Experiment Monitoring: Draw 1 card.
[reaction] After another investigator at your location gains any number of resources on your turn, exhaust Experiment Monitoring: Gain 2 resources.

cards.name: Find Cues
cards.text: Max 2 Finds per round. Find -- Choose an investigator to discover 1 clue at their location.

cards.name: Find Strength
cards.text: Max 2 Finds per round. Find -- An investigator at your location reveals the top card of their deck. That investigator may commit that card to each eligible skill test (without discarding it) until they draw a card.

cards.name: Research Funding
cards.text:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing.
Other investigators can commit cards to this skill test from any location. If the test is successful, any investigator that committed a card to this skill test draws 1 card.

cards.name: Find Yourself
cards.text: Max 2 Finds per round. Find -- An investigator at your location may choose and take two different actions of the following, in any order, as if it were their turn (move, evade, parley, play, or investigate).

cards.name: Beatrice Sharpe
cards.text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] When you would succeed at a skill test, exhaust Beatrice Sharpe: You may spend any number of resources to add that amount to your skill value for that test. Then, you may search the top X cards of your deck for a card, draw it, and shuffle your deck. X is the amount you succeed by.

cards.flavor: "There's never enough lead."
cards.name: Ammo Belt
cards.text: Uses (3 ammo). [free] Exhaust Ammo Belt: Move 1 ammo from Ammo Belt to a Firearm asset you control.

cards.name: Chicago Typewriter
cards.text: Uses (4 ammo). [action] Exhaust Chicago Typewriter and spend 1 ammo: Fight. You may spend any number of additional actions when you perform this attack. You get +2 [combat] for this attack for each action being spent (including this ability's [action] cost). This attack deals +1 damage. If you succeed by 2 or more, ready Chicago Typewriter.

cards.flavor: "If you cannot pay your own goons how am I supposed to profit from your endeavors?"
cards.name: Edmund Mallory
cards.text: [reaction] When a Forced ability on a player card would make you lose, pay, or spend resources, exhaust Edmund Mallory: Gain 2 resources.

cards.flavor: "Our exchange is merely academical, keep it that way."
cards.name: Informant's Dossier
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the upkeep phase: You must either pay 1 resource and draw a card, or discard Informant's Dossier.

cards.flavor:
"When haven't I paid you back, unc?"
"I don't know, like, every single time?"
cards.name: Family Loan
cards.text: Fast. Gain 3 resources. Forced - Attach Family Loan to your investigator. At the end of the round, lose 3 resources and discard Family Loan

cards.name: Start Blastin'
cards.text: As an additional cost to play Start Blastin', spend 1 ammo from a Firearm asset, and exhaust a Criminal asset you control. Resolve an [action] ability on a Firearm asset you control without paying its [action] cost. You get +2 skill value for the test. The attack deals +1 damage. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.flavor: "Who needs extra magazines? Faster this way."
cards.name: Swapping Arsenal
cards.text: Choose a Firearm asset you control and discard it. Then, search the top 9 cards of your deck for a Firearm asset and play it, reducing its cost by X. X is the cost of the Firearm asset discarded. Shuffle your deck.

cards.flavor: The Family's favourite day. For the boss, at least.
cards.name: Turn In
cards.text: Gain 2 resources. For each Criminal asset under your control, gain 2 additional resources.

cards.flavor: "Shapiro, you're up."
cards.name: Backup
cards.text: Commit to a skill test only if you control a Criminal asset. Max 1 committed per skill test. If this test is successful, gain 1 resource and draw 1 card.

cards.flavor: Some things just require a little money.
cards.name: Bribery
cards.text: Forced - If you would succeed at this skill test, pay 1 resource (if you cannot, take 1 damage). You get +2 skill value for this test.

cards.name: Access the Vault
cards.text: Add Access the Vault to the victory display and immediately end your turn.

cards.flavor: Some things just require a lot of money.
cards.name: Bribery
cards.text: Forced - If you would succeed at this skill test, pay 1 resource (if you cannot, take 1 damage). You get +4 skill value for this test.

cards.flavor: "Don't look at me like that, he wasn't using it anymore!"
cards.name: .45 Automatic
cards.text: Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. [reaction] After you defeat or evade a Humanoid enemy: Put .45 Automatic into play from your hand.

cards.flavor:
"When haven't I paid you back, unc?"
"Oh shut up and take the money."
cards.name: Family Loan
cards.text: Fast. Gain 5 resources. Forced - Attach Family Loan to your investigator. At the end of the round, lose 5 resources and discard Family Loan

cards.flavor: "If you cannot pay your own goons how am I supposed to profit from your endeavors?"
cards.name: Edmund Mallory
cards.text: You get +1 [agility]. [reaction] When a Forced ability on a player card would make you lose, pay, or spend resources, exhaust Edmund Mallory: Gain 3 resources.

cards.flavor: "Don't worry, he also knows a guy." - Leo De Luca
cards.name: Fence
cards.text: Exceptional. Permanent. [reaction] When you play an Illicit card during your turn, exhaust Fence: The Illicit card gains fast. If it was already fast, reduce its cost by 1 instead.

cards.name: Snipe
cards.text: Resolve an [action] ability on a Ranged or Firearm asset you control without paying its [action] cost. During that action, treat each [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], and [auto_fail] symbol token you reveal as a "0" token. If this effect defeats that enemy, draw 1 card. If it is your turn, end your turn. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.flavor: "Told you it was faster."
cards.name: Swapping Arsenal
cards.text: Fast. Choose a Firearm asset you control and shuffle it into your deck. Then, search the top 9 cards of your deck for a Firearm asset and play it, reducing its cost by X. X is the cost of the Firearm asset shuffled. Shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Criminal Organization
cards.text: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. You have 2 additional ally slots, which can only be used to hold Criminal assets. Forced - At the end of the upkeep phase, for each Criminal asset you control: You must either pay 1 resource, or discard that Criminal.

cards.flavor:
"The smoke repels bad energy and..."
"Shut up or it will start attracting some very bad energy from me."
cards.name: Palo Santo
cards.text: Investigators at your location get +1 skill value while resolving an ability on a treachery card.

cards.name: Snowgrave
cards.text: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. For each point you succeed by, reduce that enemy's fight value by 1 for the next attack performed against it this phase. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this evasion attempt, you cannot move for the remainder of the round.

cards.name: Wild Magik
cards.text: Permanent. Limit 1 per deck. Purchase at deck creation. You cannot purchase reclaimed cards. After each scenario of a campaign, choose one Spell or Ritual card from your deck at random, exile it, and record [card's name] was reclaimed by your ancestors in your campaign log. Reduce the cost of the next Spell or Ritual you buy by 1 plus the exiled card's level.

cards.name: William Bowleg
cards.text:
While William Bowleg has at least 1 doom on him, you get +1 [willpower].
[action] Exhaust William Bowleg and place 1 doom on him: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a [mystic] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck.

cards.flavor: "The geometry is... abnormal, non-Euclidean, and loathsomely redolent of spheres and dimensions apart from ours"
cards.name: Incomprehensible Geometry
cards.text: Test [willpower] (5). For each point you fail by, gain 1 resource. If you succeed, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: Without mind there's no purpose.
cards.name: Mind Blank
cards.text: Fast. Play after you evade an exhausted non-Elite enemy. Discard that enemy.

cards.name: Touch of Ithaqua
cards.text: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. Immediately before this evasion, you may engage the evaded enemy. If you succeed, the next time the evaded enemy takes damage this round, it takes 1 additional damage.

cards.flavor: "It's just around the corner!"
cards.name: Tindalos Shortcut
cards.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Move to a revealed location that only connects with one other location. Then, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: "So long they believe it, the magic is real."
cards.name: Magic Trick
cards.text: If this skill test is successful during an evasion attempt, you may return an Item asset you control to your hand and play a Spell asset, or vice versa (paying its cost).

cards.flavor: Many realities, collapsed on your mind.
cards.name: Temporal Glitch
cards.text:
This skill's icons subtract from your skill value instead of adding to it.
You may cancel the first token you reveal this test and return it to the bag. Reveal a new chaos token.

cards.flavor: "Parlez avec les habitants de tombeaux!"
cards.name: Le Cultes des Ghoules
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play Le Cultes des Ghoules, you must search your bonded cards for 1 copy of Summoned Ghoul and spawn it at your location.
[action]: Search your bonded cards for 1 copy of Summoned Ghoul and spawn it at your location.

cards.flavor: The beast looks at you, expecting the moment where no other flesh but yours remains to be eaten.
cards.name: Summoned Ghoul
cards.text: Bonded (Le Cultes des Ghoules). Aloof. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase, if Summoned Ghoul is ready: It attacks another enemy or investigator at its location, if able. Immediately before resolving this effect, if there is no enemy or investigator at its location, move it one location towards the nearest one.

cards.name: Sleet Storm
cards.text: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, automatically evade all enemies at your location. They do not ready on their next upkeep phase if they are non-Elite. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this evasion attempt, each investigator at the evaded enemy's location must discard a card from their hand.

cards.name: Touch of Ithaqua
cards.text: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. Immediately before this evasion, you may engage the evaded enemy. If you succeed, the next time the evaded enemy takes damage this round, it takes 1 additional damage. If a symbol was revealed during this evasion attempt, return Touch of Ithaqua to your hand at the end of your turn.

cards.flavor: The end is here.
cards.name: Prophesy
cards.text: For every 2 doom in play, Prophesy gains [wild].

cards.name: Snowgrave
cards.text: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. You get +2 [willpower] for this evasion attempt. For each point you succeed by, reduce that enemy's fight value by 1 for the next attack performed against it this phase. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this evasion attempt, you cannot move for the remainder of the round.

cards.name: Explosive Glyph
cards.text: Attach to your location. Limit 1 Glyph per location. Forced - After an enemy enters attached location: Deal 2 damage to that enemy. Forced - At the end of the round, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, discard Explosive Glyph.

cards.name: Freezing Glyph
cards.text: Attach to your location. Limit 1 Glyph per location. Forced - After an enemy enters attached location: Automatically evade that enemy. Forced - At the end of the round, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, discard Freezing Glyph.

cards.name: Seeking Glyph
cards.text: Attach to your location. Limit 1 Glyph per location. Forced - After an enemy enters attached location: Discover one clue at the attached location or a connecting location. Forced - At the end of the round, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, discard Seeking Glyph.

cards.name: Robes of Endless Night
cards.text: You have 1 additional arcane slot, which can only be used to hold a Spell or Ritual asset. [reaction] When you play a Spell or Ritual card, exhaust Robes of Endless Night: Reduce the cost of that card by 1. Playing that card does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.name: Facón
cards.text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. [free] Exhaust Facón: Fight. Activate only during your turn, and only if you have no cards in your hand. If you succeed, you may discard Facón to deal +1 damage.

cards.name: Old Rake
cards.text: [action]: Investigate. After this investigation, your location gets -1 shroud until the end of this turn. [free] Exhaust Old Rake: Investigate. Activate only during your turn, and only if you have no cards in your hand. If you succeed, you may discard Old Rake to discover a clue at a connecting location instead.

cards.name: Toolbox
cards.text: [reaction] After Toolbox enters play: Choose 3 Tool cards not named Toolbox from your discard pile, and attach them facedown to Toolbox. Cards attached to Toolbox may be played as if they were in your hand. If there are no cards attached to Toolbox, discard it.

cards.name: Follow the Trail
cards.text: Investigate. If you have... - ... 2 or fewer cards in hand, you may ignore any effect or keyword on your location which would trigger during this investigation. - ... 1 or fewer cards in hand, your location gets -1 shroud for this investigation. - ... no cards in hand, if you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at your location.

cards.flavor: "Does a boy get a chance to draw three cards every day?"
cards.name: Inventive Solutions
cards.text:
Play only if this card is the last one in your hand.
Draw 3 cards.

cards.name: Like the Predator
cards.text: Fight. If you have... - ... 2 or fewer cards in hand, you may ignore the retaliate keyword for this attack. - ... 1 or fewer cards in hand, you may immediately engage the attacked enemy. - ... no cards in hand, this attack deals +2 damage.

cards.name: Like the Prey
cards.text: Evade. If you have... - ... 2 or fewer cards in hand, you may ignore the alert keyword for this evasion attempt. - ... 1 or fewer cards in hand, you may Move or Engage before or after this evasion attempt. - ... no cards in hand, if you succeed, the enemy does not ready during the next upkeep phase.

cards.flavor: Even a little goes a long way.
cards.name: Spare Change
cards.text:
You cannot play Spare Change from your hand.
Gain 2 resources.
[reaction] After you discard Spare Change during your turn: Play it.

cards.flavor: Only by standing far away from the darkness can we live to see the light of another day.
cards.name: Fearful
cards.text: If this skill test is successful, heal 1 damage.

cards.flavor: "Hold it boy..."
cards.name: Patience
cards.text: [reaction] After you discard Patience from your hand: Put it into play in your play area. You must commit it to the next eligible skill test you perform.

cards.name: Live and Learn
cards.text:
Fast. Play when you would fail a skill test, cancel all effects of the failed test.
Attempt that test again. You get +2 skill value for this test.

cards.name: Patience
cards.text: [reaction] After you discard Patience from your hand: Put it into play in your play area. You must commit it to the next eligible skill test you perform. If that test is successful, draw 1 card.

cards.flavor: You're never going to leave me, won't you Mr. Pawterson?
cards.name: Getting By
cards.text:
[reaction] At the beginning of the upkeep phase: If you have no cards in your hand, draw 1 card.
[reaction] At the beginning of the upkeep phase: If you have no resources in your resource pool, gain 1 resource.

cards.flavor: Maybe that wasn't so little...
cards.name: Spare Change
cards.text:
You cannot play Spare Change from your hand.
Gain 3 resources (4 resources instead if you have no cards in your hand).
[reaction] After you discard Spare Change during your turn: Play it.

cards.name: Tool Improvisation
cards.text: Permanent. Exceptional. [reaction] Before you draw your opening hand: Search your deck for up to 3 different Tools assets, and attach them facedown to Tool Improvisation. Shuffle your deck. Cards attached to Tool Improvisation are considered to be in your discard pile for player card effects. [free] Discard 1 card from your hand, exhaust Tool Improvisation: Add a Tool card from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Double Shift
cards.text: After you commit Double Shift to a skill test, search your discard pile for a skill you can commit to this test, and commit it. After this test ends, if it was successful, add that skill to your hand instead of discarding it, and remove Double Shift from the game.

cards.name: Facón
cards.text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. [free] Exhaust Facón: Fight. Activate only during your turn, and only if you have no cards in your hand. If you succeed, you may discard Facón to deal +2 damage.

cards.name: Old Rake
cards.text: [action]: Investigate. After this investigation, your location gets -2 shroud until the end of this turn. [free] Exhaust Old Rake: Investigate. Activate only during your turn, and only if you have no cards in your hand. If you succeed, you may discard Old Rake to discover an additional clue at a connecting location.

cards.flavor: "And if anyone wants to sue you and take your shirt, hand over your coat as well."
cards.name: Turn the Other Cheek
cards.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] After you discard a card during your turn, exhaust Turn the Other Cheek: Take a basic action. Resolve all skill tests performed during that action with a base skill value of 5.

cards.name: Joint Effort
cards.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Joint Effort to any type of test.
Joint Effort gains [wild] for each copy of Joint Effort in each investigator's discard pile.

cards.name: Mate
cards.text:
Fast. Uses (4 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply, exhaust Mate: Heal 1 damage from an investigator at your location (2 damage instead if he or she has 2 or more physical trauma).
[action] Spend 1 supply, exhaust Mate: Heal 1 horror from an investigator at your location (2 horror instead if he or she has 2 or more mental trauma).

cards.flavor: Money is the root of all evil.
cards.name: Avarice
cards.text: Multiplayer only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. While Avarice is in your hand, you cannot spend resources. [free] If Avarice did not entered your hand this round: Give control of it to another investigator at your location.

cards.flavor: A curse bestowed will ill intent.
cards.name: Mal de Ojo
cards.text: Multiplayer only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. While Mal de Ojo is in your hand, you cannot draw more than 1 card per round. [free] If Mal de Ojo did not entered your hand this round: Give control of it to another investigator at your location.

cards.flavor: Misfortune lingers like a shadow.
cards.name: Mufa
cards.text: Multiplayer only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. While Mufa is in your hand, you get -1 to each of your skills. [free] If Mufa did not entered your hand this round: Give control of it to another investigator at your location.

cards.flavor: Too much alone time is never good.
cards.name: Recluse
cards.text: Multiplayer only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. While Recluse is in your hand, as an additional cost to move, take 1 horror. [free] If Recluse did not entered your hand this round: Give control of it to another investigator at your location.
